head.title: National Briefing | Washington: Carbon Dioxide Emissions Jumped In 2000

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Washington: Carbon Dioxide Emissions Jumped In 2000

abstract.p: Energy Dept repors that American emissions of carbon dioxide from burning fossil fuels rose 2.7 percent in 2000, much higher rate than average 1.5 percent annual rise through 1990's (S)6

block.p: American emissions of carbon dioxide from burning fossil fuels rose 2.7 percent in 2000, a much higher rate than the average 1.5-percent annual rise through the 1990's, the Energy Department said. The emissions rose because of strong economic growth, cold weather that increased oil use and a drop in electricity generation by dams, the department said. Carbon dioxide accounts for 80 percent of the country's output of heat-trapping greenhouse gases, officials said.
